IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

Job Title: QA Engineer - Mobile - Remote (to GMT +2) / Dublin
Description:
Would you like to help to create the future of a product used by thousands of businesses and millions of consumers? Phorest Salon Software powers over 9,000 hair and beauty salons in the UK, Ireland, Germany, Australia, Finland, the USA and Canada and the platform processes 7 million appointments a month for hair and beauty consumers. Phorest is the number 1 salon software brand for premium independent salons in those markets and our next goal is to become a platform upon which other companies can build applications for premium salons.

Our system touches every point of the salon experience - from the in-salon software appointment calendar and CRM with a fully integrated marketing suite, to staff apps to payments. We are also the window through which the salon provides their end customer with an amazing experience through custom native apps, eCommerce and online bookings. Why? Because we want to help salons find their dream clients and get them back more often and spending more.

The Opportunity

Quality is critical within the company to ensure customer satisfaction and retention, driving growth, and helping clients extract maximum value from our products.

We are growing fast and would like to add a new experienced member to the QA group. You will join a small group of highly skilled engineers in building exciting new features and extending our platform. Given we are a small team of engineers, you will have autonomy and control to shape our product vision without bureaucracy or politics.

You will be a key member in the Mobile team, automating test suits and bulletproofing the future of our multi-tenant SAAS platform.

What you’ll do 
Be hands on testing new features and performing regression tests for various services
Design, develop and execute both manual and automated tests to verify the functionality of the system
Develop regression automated test suites
Identify, report and track issues to resolution
Help developers reproduce errors, and ensure that defects are fixed
Be a member of multifunctional scrum teams, working closely with POs, designers and developers with "shift left" approach
Participate in scrum gatherings for team’s projects
Not afraid to be responsible for signing off the feature to be released
Analyze features during the design and development process to point out weaknesses or ambiguities
Create/review stories, bugs and test documents
Be an automation quality advocate and lifetime learner
Interested in testing automation and want to improve further in that field
Never stop learning, pursue latest technologies, seek for best solutions
Always looking to improve
Challenge the norm and won’t be afraid to voice your opinions
Eager to find better solutions and capable to spike and implement it


What we’re looking for

2+ years automation testing experience using scripting languages like javascript / python
Excellent manual testing skills and out-of-the-box adhoc testing skills
Experience with Mobile testing including automation for native mobile apps (we build cross platform apps with react native)
Excellent knowledge of testing methodologies and testing documents
Experience working in multifunctional teams in a scrum environment
Excellent skills for testing web based applications and how to locate any element on the page
Knowledge of relational and nosql databases
Good writing skills
Good communication skills
Curious mindset


Nice to Have

Experience with microservices and distributed architectures and knowledge of how you can test them
We use Cypress and Appium here as automation tools so if you have experience with either that's a plus
Knowledge of CI/CD process and how testing can be brought in there
Github experience
Performance and security testing experience or interest


Benefits

🧘Your wellbeing is important to us - we provide private healthcare, an employee assistance program and a free online GP service (WebDoc).

💰As part of our Financial Wellbeing, we provide competitive Compensation, an Employee Share Purchase Scheme, Pension, Life Assurance, and Income Protection.

🚵🏿 We help you travel by providing a bike to work scheme as well as tax saver transport tickets.

🍼We care for your family and provide Enhanced Maternity and Paternity benefits.

🌳We grow our own timber! We provide a great learning environment including an extensive onboarding program.

🤓Career development is important to us. We even have our own in-house Learning and Development/Business coach and many online resources including LinkedIn learning.

😎We don’t believe in formal dress codes. We prefer things casual.

Check out nothingventured.rocks for our blog and Insights on building an evergreen company from the team here at Phorest.

Phorest is an equal opportunities employer and we value diversity at our company. Phorest does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

Test Software Engineer II

Overview

The Decision Management team is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test to execute on our regression test strategy forward by consistently innovating and problem-solving. The ideal candidate is passionate about software development and testing, highly motivated, intellectually curious, analytical, and possesses an ability to drive and introduce improvements to our existing regression test coverage and strategy.

Role

In This Position, You Will

 Play a crucial part in a technical test role to help drive Quality and to build, implement and execute tests, automation improvements and reporting for our regression release cycle.
 Collaborate closely with our test teams to enhance our existing software testing processes.
 Partner with integration testers, SETs and development teams to improve and automate test and release processes.
 Help make Quality an integral part of the development process.


All About You

The ideal candidate for this position should:

 Experience in core Java programing for test automation and the ability to identify, write and execute automated tests.
 Have knowledge and skills in test fundamentals and methodologies, ideally ISTQB or ASTQB qualified
 Be experienced in working with development and release teams.
 Have the ability to understand complex systems and to identify and design automated and manual test scenarios to strengthen existing test coverage.
 Be skilled at explaining technical problems succinctly and clearly.
 Test analysis and reporting ability.

Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.

Corporate Security Responsibility

Responsibilities

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must

Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;

 Mitigating risks associated with the design, use and manufacture of medical devices.

 Degree or master’s degree in science or engineering, or related disciplines

 Detailed knowledge of and ability to implement medical device quality systems for product design, risk management and product manufacture in line with specified requirements ISO 13485, MDSAP, FDA 21 CFR 820.
 Experience of terminal sterilisation processes, validations, and testing, preferably Ethylene Oxide sterilisation.

Job Description

Do you have an obsession for automation and a dream to work with a highly skilled peer group? If so, our team would like to talk with you about a Senior Quality Engineer role on one of our Dublin based scrum teams within our Fidelity Capital Markets team.

The Purpose of Your Role

You will perform the role of a Senior Software Quality Engineer on one of our scrum teams. You will be responsible for ensuring that our teams deliver a high-quality product to our customers.

The Expertise We’re Looking For


A BS or MS Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent.
5 years of related experience, ideally within a technology environment.
Experience with technologies to implement Test Automation such as
Cucumber, Cypress, Java, Selenium, Serenity

Experience with Web Services testing such as
Rest Assured, SOATest, SOAPUI, POSTMAN, SWAGGER, Service Virtualization

Familiar with SQL or similar database query technologies.
Understanding of all aspects of the Testing Pyramid – Unit Testing, Component Testing, Integration Testing, Functional Testing and Manual Testing.
Knowledge of Jenkins or other continuous integration systems.
Adept at delivering in an Agile environment.


The Skills you bring

Natural ability to nurture strong transparent and trusting relationships with Partners.
Demonstrated experience at building strong relationships.
Experience of championing innovative QA ideas.
Ability to influence and champion ideas across management levels and diverse groups.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Collaborate and communicate openly and effectively with team mates.
Effective at traversing the gap across distributed teams.
Dynamic ‘can do’ attitude with a strong appetite to make things happen.


You Deliver Value To Fidelity By

Gaining an understanding of the high-level component makeup of the Product.
Working with our Scrum Master & Product Owner to understand release dates and objectives for the product.
Analysing Acceptance Criteria to understand the full picture of the business value being delivered.
Identifying potential gaps in Acceptance Criteria and working with Product Owner & Systems Analysts to update criteria accordingly.
Actively participate in planning and the other agile ceremonies for the team.
Defining test data requirements.
Writing automated / manual test cases to encompass the Acceptance Criteria in a User Story.
Logging defects detected by your test case and co-ordinating prioritization with your Product Owner.
Facilitating reviews of Test Cases with your scrum team to ensure that all paths are covered by your tests.
Performing smoke tests on environments following deployments.
Aggregating appropriate automated test scripts to be executed as part of the Test Set for a release.
Calling out test environment stability issues and outages.


How Your Work Impacts the Organization

The position aligns to the Capital Markets division of FBT (Fidelity Brokerage Technology). Capital Markets is the institutional trading arm of Fidelity, delivering brokerage and trading solutions worldwide for institutional and retail customers. The engineering team provides software engineering, application development and project management for FBT Capital Markets applications. - Successful candidates will be proactive, able to work independently and collaborate with a large amount of stakeholders on numerous concurrent projects.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Electronic Engineering, or equivalent experience.

 
Role Number: 200365912

We are looking for a Mobile QA Engineer to join our Mobile Development team in Dublin!

Are you our next star player?

As a Mobile QA Engineer, you'll be collaborating with the QA manager and you will participate in delivering applications to millions of players all over the world. Together with your team members, you take the responsibility of testing the applications under development.

Why we need you

We work in a highly regulated industry and as such, all software applications developed are subject to strict regulatory requirements. Testing these applications must be done in this context with only the highest level of quality acceptable.

Who We’re Looking For

As a successful candidate you will be able to demonstrate your ability to work with local and remote teams, as well as being able to work on your own initiative, all in a fast paced highly multifaceted working environment.

Your experience

At least 2 years hands-on experience with manual testing of native iOS and Android apps. (various versions and flavours)
Experience in building and designing test cases from user stories.
Ability to gather debug information using the relevant SDK tools for iOS or Android
Knowledge of the Atlassian toolset; Jira, Confluence etc.
Knowledge of the deployment mechanisms in use e.g. Continuous Integration systems such as Jenkins
Prior use of test support systems such as TestFlight, HockeyApp, App Center
ISTQB Certified to foundation level or better would be a distinct advantage
Your skills

You have good analytical & problem solving skills and the capability to pay strict attention to detail. You know what it's like working with teams of offshore and near-shore software testers. You have strong documentation and interpersonal skills. You have worked in a fast paced Agile environment, responding to constantly evolving business needs. A BSc degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field would be considered an advantage.

What’s in it for you?

Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.

Your package will include

health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
1000 EUR as congratulations if you have a baby whilst you work for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?

If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a phone interview. And if that goes well, we’ll meet you for a face-to-face interview.

The Group

PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.

We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact talent@starsgroup.com.

Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

Cork är Irlands näst största stad och enligt befolkningen- “Irlands riktiga huvudstad”. Det är en väldigt modern och välkomnande stad som efter en ekonomisk lågkonjunktur nu lägger mycket fokus på nya vackra vyer längst kusten, aktiviteter och kulturell rikedom i varje hörn.

Företaget är ett globalt tech företag som har anställda världen över. Som deras nya kollega kommer du att jobba i ett internationellt klimat med fokus på det svenska språket i uppbyggnaden av framtidens IT lösningar. De lägger stort fokus på att leverera kundernas program i tid, med hög kvalitet.

En trevlig och familjär arbetsmiljö
Hälsoförsäkring 
4 veckors betalt boende

4 veckors utbildning

Ansvarig för kvalitets analys

Proffs på kommunikation i både tal och skrift
Anpassningsbar till byte av miljö 


Om kraven ovan stämmer på dig, du vill bo i Irlands andra största stad och jobba för ett globalt företag så är det här en perfekt tjänst för dig!

BIOVIA Software Quality Engineer - EuroNorth 

Imagine new horizons…

Do you want to be inspired and enjoy coming to work? At Dassault Systèmes, we empower our employees and support their passion to change the world and create the future. Let’s design new horizons together with the power of 3DEXPERIENCE virtual universes! Shape your career with 3DS! Visit our website - www.3DS.com.

BIOVIA solutions create an unmatched scientific management environment that can help science-based organizations create and connect biological, chemical and material innovations to improve the way we live.

The industry-leading BIOVIA portfolio integrates the diversity of science, experimental processes and information requirements, end-to-end, across research, development, QA/QC and manufacturing. Capabilities include Scientific Informatics, Molecular Modeling/Simulation, Data Science, Laboratory Informatics, Formulation Design, BioPharma Quality & Compliance and Manufacturing Analytics.

What will your role be?

The BIOVIA team within Dassault Systèmes Ltd is looking for a highly motivated Quality Engineer to join our software testing team focusing on BioPharma Quality & Compliance:

You will be part of the Ireland Quality Assurance team with strong links to a global team of leading compliance and regulated industry experts developing and supporting our software products 
Perform best in class quality assessment to secure, up-front, successful usage of 3DS solutions
Optimize testing cycle time for accelerated delivery while improving test coverage for product quality and customer use

The challenge ahead

Using your experience to review functional specifications and support test strategy definition through working on an Agile project team
Collaborating with all project stakeholders to create and execute functional and non-functional test plans and test suites across a range of products
Verify quality exit criteria and work with project team to identify and escalate software quality issues and help to define recovery plans
Continuously improve tests and software quality by evolving test suites for efficiency and coverage and optimizing test scenarios for automation
Leveraging customer usage and user feedback to improve test effectiveness whilst advocating for customer software quality expectations

Your key success factors:

A Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
Previous software QA experience
Working knowledge of Agile, SCRUM and DevSecOps methodologies
Demonstrate the motivation to deliver high quality software in highly regulated environment and passionate about building a career in Software Testing
Direct experience using Agile test asset management tools
Hands on experience of Security Testing methodologies and Tools (OWASP)
Direct acquaintance with 21 CFR Part 11 or equivalent regulated industry standards
Java and .NET experience is desirable
Quality assurance methodologies is beneficial 
Testing procedures, minimum ISTQB foundation level qualification is useful
Broad knowledge of IT, including computer architecture, relational databases and networking is a plus
Demonstrate effective communication skills when collaborating with project stakeholders is advantageous
Highly organized with critical attention to detail
Ability to work independently and/or within a collaborative team structure
Positive, self-motivated individual with high level of interest and passion, a willingness to learn

As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonised Workforce of the Future.

Do What You Love. Love What You Do.

At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.

About The Team

The Planning platform teams’ driving goal is to provide a reliable, scalable, and easy to use technology platform for all of our Adaptive Planning applications. Our Adaptive Planning Platform consists of four main areas: tenant lifecycle management, service infrastructure, persistent data management, and our in-memory compute engine to provide best-in-class planning solutions against very large data sets and complex planning models.

About The Role

You will be a key contributor to Workday’s Planning next generation platform and will be responsible for delivering a secure high-performing solutions and services.
You will collaborate with Developers, DevOps, and other QA engineers on secure coding practices through all steps of the SDLC to prevent application and configuration related vulnerabilities.
Develop, automate, and maintain highly effective test cases in a CI/CD environment during each sprint of the Agile life cycle
Continuously curate and enhance test case repository, automated tests, framework, and tool sets to meet best practices and standards
Strong interpersonal and communication skills as this job involves interacting with multiple teams.


About You

Basic Qualifications

A Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience contributing to test strategy for complex software applications
Experience with selenium
3+ years of experience working with development and QA as SDET or automation engineer
Experience infrastructure and application level testing
Experience with Selenium is required
Proven experience in programmatically testing software products and automating those tests
Skilled in building robust, scale-able, and high-quality test automation solutions for functional and regression testing
Strong analytical and debugging skills
Ability to build test strategy and work independently on complex projects
Understanding of data structure and ability to construct SQL statements
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, IT or equivalent work is required


Experience with some or all of the following is highly desirable:

Experience with Java
Experience writing automated tests in a Continuous Integration (CI) systems
Experience working with scalable data platforms like Kubernetes, Kafka, Augury or the like
Knowledge of security operations such as Cross-site scripting, cross site request forgery, SQL injection, DoS attacks, XML/SOAP, API attacks etc.
Experience with AWS cloud security
Experience building automation test framework

Trūata is a leading provider of privacy-enhanced data management solutions, including privacy-centric data management software, data anonymization services and a SaaS-based privacy-enhanced data analytics platform. Founded by Mastercard and IBM in 2018, Trūata is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, with international operations in New York and London.




Trūata is now recruiting for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer in Ireland. Within Trūata, we have a different view on what is a Quality Engineer. Instead of being a tester our Quality Engineers are there to guide & mentor the developers and product owners to ensure that quality practices, testing, test automation are built into the development process. Quality Engineers setup the standards, test frameworks, test tooling and then assist with the adoption of these within the agile teams. Within Trūata, Quality Engineers are more akin to quality assistants and advisors rather than traditional testers. This role reports to the CTO.




The Role

As part of one or more agile teams, you will implement the QA framework standards and test strategy within those agile team(s)
Design & Develop UI automated tests and automated tests at Service/API layer to execute within Jenkins, CI/CD pipelines as part of the development process
Work with Product Owners, Developers to ensure that sprint Stories have clear acceptance criteria, and that agile team members are advised on any aspects of quality and testing for the sprint ahead
Work with Snr Developers and Dev Managers to give testability feedback on architecture designs
Work with Developers to design & document test cases for their Stories in a collaborative manner
Ensure that sufficient testing is completed during the sprint to ensure that sprint goals are achieved, highlighting any potential risks to the end of sprint goals
Review unit tests, integration tests and static code analysis within the team to ensure that enough coverage is in place
Implement simple measurements and quality metrics within the team to measure test case coverage, automation test case coverage
Design overall testing approach for larger projects and feature the agile team will develop
Promote an agile and quality driven engineering and development culture with the team




What you need: 

University degree in Computer Science or equivalent
6+ years of quality assurance and test engineering experience
ISTQB Foundation or Advanced Level Certificate’s
Experience of test case management tools such as TestRail, Zephyr, XRay
Solid experience of programming in one of either Python, Java, JavaScript
Previous experience in test automation tools such as Selenium, Cypress
Solid hands-on experience with test planning, test designing and execution
Experience of CI tools (Jenkins, BitBucket, Gitlab)
Experience in BDD frameworks (Cucumber)
Experience in Rest Assured, Postman or other API testing frameworks
Experience working in an Agile environment
Creativity and a passion for working software from a customer perspective

 

Benefits

We take pride in offering an energetic and contemporary employee experience, supported by and array of benefits that provide our employees and their families with flexibility, quality and value. These include excellent health insurance, contributory pension scheme and free lunches!




Life at Truata

At Trūata, we celebrate our successes and grow from our learnings. We invest in smart decision making for our future, and we’re honest and ethical in everything we do. And with our eminently client-centric approach, our customers are the beating heart of our entire business model.

Cutting-edge technologies. Challenging work. A fast-paced environment—and a warm, supportive culture. If you’re eager to learn, ready to broaden your mind, and passionate about innovating novel solutions to novel problems, Trūata might just be for you.

Role Number: 200304514

GlobalReach delivers high‐performance software, services and analytics to some of the world's leading service providers and their customers. Our software and cloud‐based platform powers some of the most complex Wi‐Fi solutions for the World's biggest brands, delivering billions of Wi-Fi authentications.

GlobalReach is committed to offering their staff a rewarding and prosperous career journey, so this is a great time to join a successful and dynamic team that's at the cutting edge of technology within the Wi-Fi Industry.

This is a great opportunity to join the company that's going through rapid growth. GlobalReach is tremendously proud of its dynamic culture, which is one that encourages people to be themselves and speak their mind. GlobalReach is a firm believer in shared success opposed to individual.

GlobalReach is looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer that can ensure that all of the software used on our platforms is operating according to the relevant specification. Develop Automation, perform System testing and drive quality assurance of code and configuration. Document test activities, log defects and ensure that re-testing takes place to confirm that problems encountered have been resolved. Work in accordance with testing standards developed in-house and contribute to the continuous improvement of testing standards and automation.

Key Responsibilities

Play a central role in adding to our extensive automation capabilities in testing our core platforms.
Create QA documentation for our external QA teams to work with.
Participate in requirements walkthrough meetings (KO meeting).
Performing manual and exploratory testing across major feature releases, and regression testing where necessary.
Working with analysts & developers to write test cases for new changes.
Diagnose problems and report bugs/enhancements.
Tracking quality assurance metrics, like change failure rate and open defect counts.
Participate in daily scrum calls with other delivery teams to support issues’ triage process and understand prioritisation of work assignments.
Log bugs, reporting the issue to the developers and taking full ownership and accountability following up to ensure that corrective action is taken.


Requirements

A positive attitude and a hunger to be the best you can be.
1+ years software testing experience throughout all phases of a software testing cycle, including automation experience.
Experience using a test management tools.
Automation & Scripting knowledge, ability to create automated tests utilizing frameworks & tools.
Quality focused with strong attention to detail.
Self-motivated with ability to work on own initiative or as part of a team.
Knowledge of Unit testing, UI Testing, and Integration testing of APIs.
Experienced with Atlassian Toolset (JIRA).
BSc in Computer Science is preferred but not essential.


Benefits

Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Pension Plan
Stock Option Plan
Competitive with equity opportunity

Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer - Suppliers and Third Party Distributors
Description:
The primary function of this role is to provide Quality Assurance support to the monitoring, approval and appraisal of suppliers and third-party distributors from a quality perspective. Another important aspect of this role is to provide QA support and guidance to departments liaising with suppliers, third-party intermediaries as well as internal stakeholders. This includes, but is not limited to, conducting QA risk assessment activities as part of the selection and approval of third-party distributors, conducting pre-qualification and monitoring audits on suppliers and third-party distributors, drafting and updating Quality System Documentation, preparing change orders, and supporting the Cook Medical Corrective and Preventive Action program.


 Provide Quality Assurance support to the Governance, Contracts and Audit function, as well as the Corporate Audit and Supplier Quality team 
 Conduct QA risk assessment activities for suppliers and third-party distributors - both retrospective and prospective. 
 Create a plan for clearly communicating key QA risk assessment criteria to a large population of existing third-party distributors as well as to internal Cook stakeholders, ensuring the receipt of timely responses from these recipients 
 Evaluate third-party distributor and stakeholder responses in order to identify risk, approve or decline from a QA perspective, as well as to assign QA risk classifications to each third-party distributor in a systematic way. 
 Document and archive risk assessment documentation, as well as populating risk classification information on third-party distributor profiles, 
 Conduct pre-qualification and monitoring audits on suppliers and third-party intermediaries, based on risk. 
 Manage and drive continuous improvement activities focusing on quality assurance in the areas or supplier and third-party distributor management. 
 Provide input and support to the Cook Medical Corrective and Preventive Action program (CAPAs) 
 Support any required software validation activities. 
 Support Cook Medical’s Internal Audit program 
 Other job responsibilities as assigned 
 Ensure that Cook’s Code of Conduct is considered in all business matters carried out on Cook’s behalf. 

 Third Level qualification in Science, Engineering or a relevant technical discipline. 
 Qualification in Quality/Validation/Statistics would be a distinct advantage. 
 Proven knowledge and experience (ideally minimum 4 years) of working with ISO13485, ISO14971, the Medical Device Directive, EU Medical Device Regulation 2017/745 and the FDA QSR including 21 CFR Part 820 and 21 CFR Part 11, ideally gained in the medical device industry. 
 Knowledge and experience of China’s Good Supply Practice for Medical Devices (GSP) and other regional standards in APAC would be an advantage 
 Qualified Lead Auditor, preferably within the Medical Device Industry desirable. 
 Proven knowledge and experience of all aspects of Validation including Process Validation and design validation. 
 Good working knowledge of statistics. 
 Strong interpersonal skill with the ability to communicate effectively at all organisational levels. 
 The ability to challenge thinking/opinion/actions in light of ensuring Cook Medical Quality Systems and Processes are adhered to. 
 High attention to detail in all aspects of the role. 
 Excellent organisational skills. 
 Proven problem-solving skills. 
 High self-motivation. 
 Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office. 
 Willingness and availability to travel on company business.

Advance level proficiency in SQL

• Experience in Agile development methodologies preferable

• Proven ability to deliver quality results in a busy and dynamic business focused environment

• Experience in the Health Care/ Insurance / or specific knowledge of Blockchain would be a distinct advantage

Job Title: French Language QA Engineer - French Canadian IE
Description:
Nous vous offrons la possibilité de combiner tout cela avec un lieu de travail où vous pourrez faire progresser votre carrière. Pour notre client, il s'agit de trouver un nouveau collègue qui aime travailler avec les gens et qui a une véritable passion.

La deuxième ville d'Irlande est la première à tous les égards importants, du moins selon les habitants, qui la qualifient allègrement de "véritable capitale de l'Irlande". C'est une ville libérale, jeune et cosmopolite qui a été durement touchée par la récession économique, mais qui s'active à se réinventer avec des rues embellies, des fronts de mer revitalisés et - apparemment - un café artisanal à chaque coin de rue. La scène est un peu hipster, mais la meilleure partie de la ville reste joyeusement traditionnelle - des pubs confortables avec des sessions de musique live, des restaurants proposant des produits locaux de qualité et un accueil vraiment fier de la population locale.

Il s'agit d'une entreprise technologique d'envergure mondiale qui emploie des personnes dans le monde entier. Elle veille à ce que les programmes de ses clients soient livrés à temps et avec la meilleure qualité possible.

L'offre du département de Cork :

 Un environnement de travail agréable et convivial
 Assurance maladie
 4 semaines d'hébergement
 Carte de réduction pour les magasins/restaurants
 4 semaines de formation


Ce que vous ferez dans le cadre de votre travail :

Être responsable du contrôle de la qualité 
Focus sur le traitement du langage naturel 
Focus sur les aspects internationaux du logiciel de reconnaissance vocale
Enquêter sur les bogues des logiciels et les détecter
Étendre la couverture linguistique et de domaine, et rédiger des cas d'essai pour de nouveaux scénarios d'utilisation
Tout autre droit applicable


Nous recherchons un candidat avec :

Excellente maîtrise du français Canadian et de l’anglais
Motivé et proactif
Compétences exceptionnelles en matière d'analyse, de dépannage et de résolution de problèmes 
Être capable de penser de manière créative et critique
Licence/Master en ingénierie informatique/science informatique ou expérience professionnelle équivalente
S'adapter à des environnements changeants


C'est une excellente opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise hautement technique, avec un excellent salaire et de grandes possibilités de développement si vous le souhaitez ! Heures : 40 par semaine - du lundi au vendredi

Recruteur : Marine

Email: ms@jobsqd.com

Holiday - 21 Days
Relocation - Ask the recruiter
Trial Period - 3 Months
Start Date - Now

10 tips that will give you a great start in any EU country

Cork is a city full of character and its inhabitants are known for their friendliness. You can find a nice eatery on every corner and there really is something for everyone. Within half an hour you are here on the Irish coast enjoying a deliciously fresh lobster or one of the other delicacies! Don't feel like going out of town? Cork itself has plenty to offer too, including beautiful gardens and some of Ireland's many castles. The nights are long here and there is always fun to be found somewhere. In short; you should not miss this city!

Role Number: 200268290

Do What You Love. Love What You Do.

At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.

About The Team

The Enterprise Privacy, Identity and Configurable Security (EPIC) team has an immediate opening for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to The Enterprise Privacy, Identity and Configurable Security (EPIC) team has an immediate opening for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to work at the very heart of Workday’s cloud-based software platform. We are looking for hardworking individuals to take our security product development to new heights. Access to data, reports and services is controlled by Workday's configurable security and privacy model, which flexibly enables different data access levels for different data consumers within the system. The Enterprise Privacy team works on building several key frameworks in the Workday stack to enable Workday customers to meet their global and local compliance regulations.

About The Role

We are seeking a Software Developer in Test to help us build the Privacy framework for all of Workday developers. The ideal candidate is someone passionate about testing standard methodologies and that enjoys working with both front end and back end technologies, while developing software with unique challenges including mechanisms to control access to Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and monitor how the data is used. You thrive in breaking the system before a customer does. In this role, you will :

Diagnose problems and report bugs and improvements to Development
Advocate for testing standard methodologies (drive test maintainability concepts and design patterns)
Build test methodology and test data set-up for configurations, business and transactional processing, web services and reporting
Maintain, support, and enhance existing test framework/testing infrastructure
Write automation tests to improve and support code quality in the context of a CI/CD environment
Collaborate with other teams to align on tooling and effective distribution of testing scope among teams
Think creatively and consider issues from a customer perspective, while bringing a pragmatic approach to solving issues
As a part of an agile development team, work with fellow engineers of various subject areas, product managers and automation engineers to deliver privacy platform enhancements to support Workday application development


About You

Basic Qualifications

A Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent with 3+ years of proven experience working with development and QA as SDET or automation engineer with strong object-oriented design and coding skills
Experience contributing to or leading test strategy for complex software applications
Strong experience in at least one modern programming language such as Java, Scala, C++
Hands-on experience with testing APIs through tools such as POSTMAN, CURL, or SoapUI
Experience in functional end-to-end workflow testing, including test planning and execution


Highly Desirable Qualifications

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Consistent track record of working in multi-functional teams and agile delivery
High degree of attention to detail, with an eagerness for bug-hunting, and problem-solving
Knowledge of security operations such as Cross-site scripting, Cross-site request forgery, SQL injection, DoS attacks, XML/SOAP, API attacks etc.
Authentication and Authorization experience with some of the following: LDAP, SSO, Delegated Authentication, Account Provisioning, PCI Security Standards, x509, SAML, OAuth, WS-Security, JWT, Configurable Data Security , Identity and Access Management (IAM)
Experience with SaaS security infrastructure
Experience with test automation frameworks such as Cucumber, Selenium, Mockito, etc.
Experience with Java build tools such as Ant, Maven, Gerrit, Gradle, etc.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines, tools like Bamboo or Jenkins and code revision tool like Git
Experience in Unix/Linux environment and scripting
Internal candidates: solid understanding of XO, WATS and WARP technologies, SkyLab

Möchtest du Spracherkennungs-Apps verbessern und diese so Menschen näher bringen? Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit dies mit einem internationalen Unternehmen zu verbinden und deine Karriere nach vorne zu bringen.

Wir sind auf der Suche nach einer energiegeladenen Person (m/w/d), die gerne mit Anderen zusammenarbeitet und eine Leidenschaft für Technik mitbringt.

Arbeitsbeginn: ab sofort

Cork ist die zweitgrößte Stadt Irlands und die „Locals“ sind zweifellos davon überzeugt, dass sie die schönste Stadt der Welt ist. Eine Sache, die dir schnell an dieser coolen und kosmopolitischen Stadt im Südwesten Irlands auffallen wird, ist die Liebe der Einwohner zu ihrer Stadt.

Cork, das majestätisch auf einer Insel mitten im River Lee thront, ist eine turbulente Ansammlung von schicken Cafés, angesagten Kunstgalerien, ungewöhnlichen Museen und richtig guten Pubs. Obwohl Cork eine „City“ ist, fühlt sich das Leben hier ziemlich entspannt an. Stress und Hektik? Von wegen!

Das Stadtzentrum und deren Sehenswürdigkeiten lässt sich leicht zu Fuß erkunden. Das Triskel Arts Centre definiert Kultur vollkommen neu – und bietet alles zwischen Arthouse-Kino und kleinen Gigs in der Kulisse einer wunderschön umgebauten Kirche. Im schrägen Butter Museum erhalten Sie einen überraschend interessanten Einblick in eines der historischen Gewerbe Corks. Wenn du auf der Suche nach etwas wirklich Einzigartigem bist, dann bist du in Cork genau richtig: Läute die Kirchenglocken in der Church of St Anne, erfahre mehr über die schaurige Vergangenheit des Cork City Gaol aus dem 19. Jahrhundert oder treibe auf einer der Urban Kayaking-Touren unter den Brücken der Stadt hindurch. Im Umland der Stadt triffst du auf Geschichten über die Titanic, monumentale Schlösser und hübsche Seebäder. Einer der beliebtesten Tagesausflüge von Cork aus führt dich nach Cobh. Diese wunderschöne Hafenstadt hat eine bittersüße Vergangenheit. Als einst wichtigster Auswandererhafen Irlands war Cobh der letzte Anlaufhafen der Titanic. Das Titanic Experience in den alten Büros der White Star Line erzählt auf fesselnde Weise die ganze Geschichte.

Das Unternehmen in dem du arbeiten würdest ist ein globales Technologieunternehmen und beschäftigt Mitarbeiter weltweit. Es stellt sicher, dass Kundenprogramme pünktlich und mit höchster Qualität geliefert werden.

Das Unternehmen bietet:

21 Urlaubstage im Jahr
Wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt
Hinflug wird zurückerstattet
50% der Miete wird in den ersten 6 Monaten zurückerstattet


Aufgaben:

Verantwortlich für End-to-end Benutzererfahrung mit Fokus auf Natural language processing
Arbeit im Bereich der internationalen Spracherkennungssoftware


Wir suchen:

Freude im Umgang mit Kunden
Muttersprache Deutsch
Verhandlungssicheres Englisch (schriftlich und mündlich)
Erfahrungen im QS-Ingenieur Bereich mit Client-Server Hintergrund
Selbstmotiviert und pro-aktiv
Kreative und kritische Denkweise
Fähigkeiten schnell und effizient auf Änderungen zu reagieren

Cork is een stad vol karakter en de inwoners staan bekend om hun vriendelijkheid. Je kan op iedere hoek wel een leuk eettentje vinden en er is echt voor ieder wat wils. Binnen een half uurtje zit je hier aan de Ierse kust te genieten van een heerlijke verse kreeft of een van de andere delicatessen! Geen zin om de stad uit te gaan? Cork zelf heeft ook genoeg te bieden, zoals prachtige tuinen en een aantal van de vele kastelen die Ierland rijk is. De nachten zijn hier lang en er is altijd wel ergens gezelligheid te vinden. Kortom; deze stad mag je niet missen!

Wij zijn op zoek naar een QA engineer om het team te gaan vertsterken! Het bedrijf is gespecialiseerd op een wereldwijde leverancier van een softwarelokalisatie in vertaling. Ze bieden toonaangevende oplossingen voor klanten aan met de kern van een doelstelling om hun te helpen met het uitbreiden van hun bedrijf en ook te laten groeien. Het werken bij dit bedrijf maakt het uniek omdat de werkcultuur erg flexibel is. Ook geloven zijn in creativiteit, visie en het overtreffen van verwachtingen en kansen.

De baan:

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van het begin tot in de puntjes een gebruikerservaring met een focus op een natuurlijke taalverwerking. We zijn op zoek naar een QA-ingenieur met een backoffice test achtergrond voor klanten en servers die zeer gemotiveerd is om producten van hoge kwaliteit te leveren. Elk individu in ons team maakt een duidelijk verschil voor het product. Jouw primaire verantwoordelijkheid is om u te concentreren op de internationale aspecten van spraakherkenningssoftware om een geweldig product te garanderen.


Waar wij naar op zoek zijn:

Nederlands is je moedertaal en daarnaast spreek je ook vloeiend Engels. 
 Sterke kennis van testmethoden, QA-terminologie en processen.
 Zelf-gemotiveerd en proactief met aangetoond creatief en kritisch denken
 Uitzonderlijke analytische, probleemoplossende en probleemoplossende vaardigheden.
Mogelijkheid om te werken in een snelle omgeving met veranderende prioriteiten en frequente context
Aantoonbaar vermogen om hoogwaardige resultaten op tijd te leveren.
QA ervaring

Vi tilbyder dig chancen for at blive en del af et team og arbejdsplads hvor du kan tage din karriere til det næste trin! For vores klient handler det om at finde en ny kollega, der elsker at arbejde med mennesker og som har en ægte lidenskab til sit arbejde.

Irlands næststørste by, Cork, er vigtig i enhver henseende - ihvertfald ifølge de lokale der der muntert omtaler den som ‘’Irlands Rigtige Hovedstad.’’ Det er et liberalt, ungdommeligt og kosmopolitisk sted, der blev hårdt ramt af den økonomiske recession, men som nu er travlt i gang med at revitalisere sig selv med farverige gader, et livligt miljø ved havnefronten samt kaffebarer på hvert gadehjørne, der efter sigende har baristaer der kan sit kram. Der er lidt af et hipster og ungdommeligt miljø men byen har bevaret det traditionelle med fyldte pubs der har livemusik, restauranter der serverer lokale varer af høj kvalitet.

Virksomheden er en global leverandør af softwarelokalisering, oversættelse, QA og dataanalyse til den multinationale IT-sektor. De leverer markedsledende løsninger til deres kunder.

Et godt arbejdsmiljø med venlige kollegaer 
Sundhedsforsikring 
4 ugers hotelophold når du ankommer 
Rabatter til butikker og restauranter 
4 uger oplæring

Være ansvarlig for kvalitetskontrol

Undersøg og forbedre softwareproblemer
Eventuelle andre opgaver der måtte gælde 


Dine kvalifikationer: 

Stærke stave -og grammatiske evner på både dansk og engelsk
Selvmotiveret og proaktiv
Gode analytiske evner samt løsningsorienteret
Du er i stand til at tænke kreativt og kritisk 
Du har en Bachelor el. Master i Computer Engineering/Computer Science eller tilsvarende arbejdserfaring
Du skal være omstillingsparat og kunne arbejde i forskellige miljøer

Experience in macOS and/or iOS software development
Deep knowledge of linguistics
Excellent attention to detail and a team player
A person who enjoys breaking the software in order to make it better

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Virtasant. Have you got what it takes?

Are you an expert at detecting differences between things you observe versus what you expect them to be? Do you love technology and learning new things? Are you really good at using writing to explain what you've seen?

If so, you'll love our approach to software quality testing. Our testers are guided through test scripts that are clear and specific and enable them to focus on deciding when an application is meeting or failing our high quality standards.

Unlike most QA Testers that test the same application every day, our testers never get bored and are always challenged, using their skills to test over 100 products that our customer owns.


Execute test cases with high precision and detail, diligently checking each step and documenting differences
Follow a process that includes testing in two-hour "Deep Work Blocks"
Learn new software products regularly

Executing all of your tests on the same product - we want all our QA testers to explore our portfolio of over 100 products, and we split our testing between our team members so that they can run in parallel. 
Coding - using Gherkin, you will be able to automate QA tests without any coding experience. 
Editing unit or integration tests - these are done by our software engineers. 

Execute test cases with high precision and detail, diligently checking each step and documenting differences
Follow a process that includes testing in two-hour "Deep Work Blocks"
Learn new software products regularly

A university degree (BS, MS, or PhD) that included in-depth study of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented programming, computer architecture, and software engineering
4yrs of experience as a QA Engineer
Experience in Manual or Automation QA
Experience utilizing Selenium and Postman
Experience with API testing
Willingness to work overlapping at least 5 daily hours into US EST Time zone 

Virtasant is a global cloud services provider with industry-leading technology, capabilities, and people. We've been working in the cloud, testing the limits of its capabilities, since the start. We transform, build, and optimize customers' digital experience in the cloud every day, helping companies make the most of the cloud's native capabilities. To achieve this, we've built one of the world's largest fully remote organizations.

To maintain the high quality of services that Virtasant is offering, we give all our employees a chance of attaining official cloud certification which helps them develop and grow themselves faster.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

The discipline ❤️

Our engineering discipline builds the technology that enables MoonPay to learn quickly and scale easily. We organise in small cross-functional squads of 3-5 engineers and an embedded Product Manager, Product Designer and Product Data Analyst. We currently have 3 squads across Payments / Finance, Compliance / Fraud and Core Product / Growth. Over time these squads will split out and we are also building new squads focusing on new revenue streams and product verticals. We’re pragmatic and believe in having fluid structure, this means people can move between teams or specialise.

QA works across all areas of MoonPay. The function will be scaling rapidly and using the latest tools and techniques to enable the teams to build better products faster. As such there will be many opportunities for continued development and learning.

Tech stack 💻

Typescript, Node.JS, GraphQL, React, React Native, Cypress, Mock Service Worker, Postgres, Heroku, AWS

What You’ll Do 👀

Advocate for quality in the product development and engineering process.
Play a role in defining how QA is done at MoonPay.
Coach an Agile delivery team in all things QA.
Mentor and coach all levels of engineers on better testing practices and standards.
Analyse and interpret quality gaps with the team.
Work closely with Product to define and prioritise work into sprints.
Embedded QA throughout the SDLC.
Lead Team Test Automation at all levels and define best practices.
Grow the internal QA community.
Assist working towards continuous integration collaborating with development and support teams.
Review and contribute to unit, integration and end to end tests when required.


You should apply if ✅

You want to own and drive QA autonomously within a team.
You are experienced in working with all members of a cross-functional team.
You have extensive experience in mentoring and/or coaching.
You possess a strong understanding of multiple test layers (including unit and contract testing).
You have a background in both UI and Backend Test Automation.
You can demonstrate an understanding of Continuous Testing and Shift Left.
You have experience being responsible for the accurate delivery of Acceptance Criteria.
You understand the holistics involved in modern QA and can guide a team on the journey to being quality focused whilst having respect for the autonomous culture.
You have experience with test automation frameworks and contributing to the design and implementation of GUI and non GUI interfaces.


Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have solid experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel you only are a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.

We promote a diverse and inclusive culture at MoonPay.

Logistics 🛠

Unfortunately, we are unable to offer visas of any kind at this time!

Recruiter call (20-30 minutes)

Benefits 💰

Stock options 📈
Unlimited holidays 🏝

Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless 🚀

Automation QA Engineer

Are you an automation test engineer passionate about customer experience and quality deliverables? Are you an avid learner who is always looking for the next evolution in technology?

We are in the process of modernising our engineering capabilities and moving from monoliths to cloud native micro services based applications. With a passion for digital assets, you will want to get involved in building our digital engineering capability to best in class both in industry and across.

We want our teams to collaborate, reducing impediments and dependencies for the benefit of our customers. We are building a great culture that we are proud of and in which everyone is expected to play a part. If this sounds like something you’d enjoy, come and join us.


Develop and agree test plans and test cases with Product Owner and engineers
Capture test cases in X-ray/Jira that support the test plan and identify specifically what needs to be tested
Review stories, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
Capture issues in Jira, reporting the issue to the engineers and take full ownership and accountability following up to ensure that corrective action was taken
Deliver assignments to agreed quality standards and in line with industry best practises
Be a passioate engineer and stive to deliver good code quality with a strong drive towards CI/CD, DevOps and Automation
Act as the SME on Automation to the Scrum team as well as the client and any client partners involved in the sprint
Ensure our solutions meet Fiserv and regulatory test standards and we have a defect free release, every time
Participate in determining standards and best practices around code quality
Contribute to the resolution of wider value trains and organisational impediments that impact the team(s)
Doing everything possible to ensure delighting customers

What you have

Strong knowledge of automation scripting using Python, Java, etc. and automation tools such Selenium and Cucumber
One or more industry certifications (ISTQB, CSTE, CASTP, CAST, etc.)
Experience working with digital tech stack e.g., HTML, CSS, Java Script, Core Java, Springboot, Scala, React, Angular, PostgreSQL, Cockroach, etc.
Experience with SCM and development tools and frameworks such as Jenkins, Maven, GitLab, JIRA, SonarQube and TDD/BDD
Experience of working in Scrum model
Understanding of the impact of technology on business outcomes and strong desire to continuosly improving technology assets and processes
Overall 4 to 8 years of experience, at least 3+ years in automation
You are pro-active, self-motivated, confident person with good organisational and communication skills
University Degree in a STEM subject strongly preferred

We would also like you to have

Experience working with APIs and micro services
Must be able to engage with global peers and have growth mindset (eager to learn)
Previous experience in credit card/payments/merchant acquiring or core banking

What we have

As FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the eighth consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation
Our DNA is financial services: we move money and information through global financial networks every second of the day
We are 44,000 strong across 100 countries and counting
We look after our associates and offer career pathways to suit your capabilities and interest
And we do like to have fun as we go along being awesome

As a QA Automation Engineer, you will play a key role in improving the quality of software produced by the team. Working closely with developers and product owners, the QA Automation Engineer will ensure the delivery of high quality software and be a vital part of building a test suite to ensure the robustness of our CI/CD release pipeline.

 

Role and Responsibilities:

 

Own and drive the test automation function.
Approach testing with goal of improving product reliability, release process and software development life cycle.
Develop and execute a test automation process in line with the core objectives of improving product reliability, building confidence in the release pipeline via automating regression testing and contribute to the shortening the software development lifecycle.
Bring knowledge and experience to the decision making around standardizing tooling and framework selection for the various testing scenarios.
We are currently using Webdriver.io, Cucumber and ChaiJS as our E2E testing stack and will seek the successful candidate to evolve this in line with new approaches and requirements. 
Work across our agile scrum teams and contribute to sprint planning by working with Manual QA and the Product Owner to agree test automation priorities, estimates and deliver fully tested scripts within agreed timelines.
Automate a suite of documented manual QA test scenarios to improve test E2E testing coverage.
Integrate all automation scripts you create into our continuous build pipeline to ensure that we have automated test coverage and reporting visibility for every build.
Sign off on regression on each release.
Ensure that the tests are reliable and the team have visibility of test results.
Contribute to the QA Automation quality bar by defining and refining a set of coding standards and automation processes in line with future team expansion plans.

 

Skills & Experience:

 

5+ years related experience in QA with a minimum of 3 years as an Automation Test.
Engineer using automated tools and frameworks such as: Selenium, JavaScript / TypeScript, Webdriver.io, ChaiJS or similar. 
Mid-level to advanced coding skills using JavaScript / TypeScript. 
A proven track record of delivering UI test automation for web, API and distributed systems.
Automating UI and API tests for environments being built using the following technologies: Angular, .NET, .NET WebAPI, .NET MVC (legacy), .NET WebForms (legacy), SQS, SQL Server, AWS, Distributed System / SOA / Microservices
Performance and load testing experience a plus including JMeter etc.
A proven track record of delivery in an Agile environment.
Experience with test management, bug tracking and agile tools e.g. Jira, Confluence or other similar.
Experience working within a Continuous Integration environment using tools like Teamcity, Octopus, AWS.
Excellent communication skills are essential.
Excellent troubleshooting skills and demonstrable evidence of your contribution towards continuous improvement within the automation sphere of influence.

Our Company

Thunkable is on a mission to democratize app development and empower everyone to build without writing a single line of code. Our platform enables anyone to build and publish their own iOS, Android, and web apps for free. Today, non-engineers use Thunkable to prototype and share new ideas, develop proofs-of-concept for their own digital business, design, and ship their own ad-supported and premium apps, and many more things. Thunkable was incubated at Google Research and MIT. We are backed by Lightspeed, NEA, SV Angel, Zhenfund, and Y-Combinator. Our founders are engineers who wanted to extend the power and fun of creation to people who don’t code. We value creativity, openness, transparency, persistence, and entrepreneurialism. The company is based in San Francisco, but operates globally, with team members working across a number of cities, countries, and time zones. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace helps ensure we learn from each other’s different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives and is critical for building a product that supports the wide range of our users’ needs. Thunkable is an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Our team is growing fast. Apply now!

About The Role

As a QA Engineer you will be responsible for ensuring that our product and services meet the established company standards. Reliability, performance and customer expectations are the key metrics to be used. Reporting and documenting findings is also a core competency for this role.

What You'll Do:

Plan, execute, and oversee inspection and testing of outgoing product to confirm quality conformance to specifications
Build upon, and comply with company quality assurance standards
Create quality measurements to track improvement in products
Work closely with the engineering and customer success teams to improve existing products


What You’ll Need

A Bachelor’s degree in a related field preferred or equivalent experience.
Customer focus and attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Great team player with the ability to work with minimal supervision

The European Localisation Quality team is seeking a highly motivated software quality engineer to help us ship world-class products to our international customers. Fluent in a European language.

At PointsBet, we have only built a fraction of what we’ve imagined.




We're on a mission to make racing and sports betting faster, easier to understand and more fun to use.




PoinstBet launched in Australia in 2017 and now, as a top 200 ASX listed company, we’re dedicated to providing all our customers with the ultimate betting experience. After kicking off in New Jersey in January 2019, we quickly expanded our operations to Iowa, Indiana, Illinois, Michigan, and Colorado, making Denver our main U.S. headquarters.




We place no limits on our team’s ability to create and develop software and customer experiences that redefine the status quo. We prioritise end-to-end ownership of our technology, control our own product roadmap and consistently strive to offer the fastest betting experience in the world.




As the business continue to experience significant growth, we are looking for a passionate, motivated Automation Test Engineer to develop and integrate best practices around software quality and testing to ensure continuous delivery of the Development Team Roadmap. You'll be highly organised, with a passion for Automation, DevOps, modern CI/CD and Infrastructure deployment practices.

Design and implement efficient, intuitive, modular and testable code
Ensure that solutions developed address a variety of concerns including performance, scalability, availability and security
Identify and present the technical trade-offs and risks of different development and testing approaches in a meaningful way
Contribute and adhere to team objectives including coding practices, continuous integration and continuous delivery processes
Contribute a comprehensive understanding of current and emerging technologies and testing tools
Be passionate about software quality, development and testing
Responsible for managing information security risks to the Company, as well as adhering to the Company’s information security policies
Successfully manage program of work; multiple concurrent projects.
Ensure projects are consistently delivered on time




The skills & experience we’re looking for:




B.S./M.S. in computer science or software engineering preferred
5+ years professional experience in a software role
Automation testing experience of API’s Web and mobile apps
Know how to write tests for microservices based architecture and distributed systems
Test planning, system testing (system requirement verification), exploratory testing and performance testing
Experience in technical solution architecture.
Experience with different development frameworks (.Net/Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, NodeJS)
Strong analytical skills (debugging, tinkering)

 Do you yearn to work in self empowered teams who hold their own destiny in their hands? At Transact Campus, we value small cross-functional self-organizing product teams. Each team has the autonomy to decide how best to build software and what tools they use to create it. 




Do you believe that a trusting, open, honest, respectful environment is key to the success of any team and organization? Do you want to continually grow your skillset, career, perceptions, and experiences through ongoing training, personal development, and learning? Our People:

As an industry leading software company, we are lucky to have deep support and experience in house with talented engineers, infrastructure experts and architects across the Transact global family working as part of and alongside our teams. Excellent communication and documentation skills who can summarize and relay all news to stakeholders

DataRobot is the leader in enterprise AI, delivering trusted AI technology and enablement services to global enterprises competing in today’s Intelligence Revolution. What does it take to develop the highest quality data science product on the market? A hybrid testing strategy that combines humans and automation and gets the best of both worlds.

Our QA philosophy at DataRobot is one of Quality “Assistance” rather than assurance; as a result, our lean team focuses on empowering every engineering team to own the quality of their code and ensure adequate test coverage for new features.

As a Software Development Engineer in Test of the Custom Models Domain, you will:


Review technical specifications and help development teams develop test strategies, to ensure we deliver a high quality platform for the DataRobot AI and ML application

Build test automation frameworks and infrastructure that uncover defects unachievable by manual methods.
Leverage your QA experiences, collaboration, and technical knowledge to improve SDLC quality and efficiency.
Carry out API and service performance testing, evaluate results, triage regressions, build reports from version to version. 
Troubleshoot and perform RCA for issues discovered during test execution.
Perform exploratory testing, communicate with product and development teams to develop a strong understanding of the project and product testing objectives

Description Of Custom Models

Custom Models domain is a team, focused on developing one of the key components of the DataRobot MLOps platform. We’re building a toolset to run user-supplied ML models and arbitrary code fully equipped with MLOps features: data drift, accuracy tracking, retraining and so on.

Some of the most important requirements of our software are high quality, durability and performance. At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.

About The Team

Workday employs the latest technologies to support the processing of billions of monthly transactions for the world's largest enterprises. The Chaos Engineering team is looking for the best candidates to help orchestrate and drive chaos engineering experiments in order to improve the resiliency and scalability of Workday’s leading enterprise management cloud.

About The Role

The position within the Chaos Engineering team is ideally suited to candidates from an engineering or QA background who possess a deep interest in software quality or systems resiliency. As a chaos engineer your focus will be to develop, execute and interpret the outcome from the chaos experiments. You will also work closely with other engineers in the team to further enhance our chaos tooling and automation resources. The team has a clear charter focusing on applying the Principles of CE in order to identify service resiliency issues, failure patterns and outages before they impact Production systems.

Team members come from diverse backgrounds including testing, engineering, support and operations, but share the same common goal - a desire to improve the quality of Workday’s industry leading enterprise SaaS solution. The role would also be suited to someone with a strong QA background with an excellent attention to detail who is looking to transition from the traditional QA approach into the cutting edge discipline that is Chaos Engineering. Workday Chaos Engineers are highly skilled and rigorous engineers who debug, measure, support, and improve our software. They play a critical role in optimizing service quality, availability and reliability across the full technology stack.

About You

Senior Chaos Engineer

Basic Qualifications

Bachelors Degree or 6+ years of equivalent relevant experience
Experience with Automated Testing
Working knowledge of QA methodology, testing techniques and approaches
Proven ability to debug/administer Linux based operating systems
Experience with different web-based technologies such as TCP/HTTP/UDP/Rest/Soap etc
Experience triaging and resolving pipeline and production issues
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Must be able to seamlessly transition between solo and team projects


Other Qualifications

Experience with Chaos Engineering and associated system resilience engineering technique
Experience with load testing tools, Jmeter, Gatling etc
Containerization: Docker/Docker compose, K8s
Experience creating automation test suites at scale
Experience triaging and resolving pipeline and production issues


Chaos Engineer

Basic Qualifications

Bachelors Degree or 3+ years of equivalent relevant experience
Working knowledge of QA methodology, testing techniques and approaches
Proven ability to debug/administer Linux based operating systems
Experience with different web-based technologies such as TCP/HTTP/UDP/Rest/Soap etc
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Must be able to seamlessly transition between solo and team projects


Other Qualifications

Experience with Automated Testing
Experience with Chaos Engineering and associated system resilience engineering technique
Experience with automated testing tools
Experience triaging and resolving pipeline and production issues

Be part of the synthetic data revolution and work with international top experts in the field of unsupervised AI

Who We Are 

 

Pico provides agile and transparent technology solutions to the Financial Markets community including infrastructure hosting, network connectivity, market data, Corvil analytics, and cloud services giving your organization the freedom to move fast. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets. From infrastructure to connectivity, we support our clients through the full trading lifecycle. We are a global company headquartered in New York, with offices in Chicago, London, Dublin, Madrid, Krakow, Singapore and Tokyo




The Role




PICO is expanding its test engineering team which is responsible for ensuring the quality of its Big Data Platform and real-time analysis products. This team delivers innovative, automated testing solutions to verify the accuracy, performance, functionality, stress, resilience and use case validation of the company’s products.

Working from our Dublin office you will be part of a collaborative and highly technical QA team, which is passionate about quality. Operating in an agile environment, you will be responsible for designing comprehensive functional and system testing strategies that ensure our industry leading product is high quality.




Responsibilities

Ensuring the quality of industry leading financial and enterprise core product features in all stages of the product life cycle, from requirements analysis, to test design and implementation
Working within a cross-functional team following agile software development methodologies to test new product features
Implementing functional and system test strategies that are cost-effective and follow QA best practice
Executing manual and automation tests covering all QA cycles: functional, regression, performance and system testing.
Identifying product defects, logging them in the system and verifying the fixes.
Tracking test progress, reporting results, forecasting areas of risk and providing mitigation plans
Using scripting and programming skills to automate tests using python and selenium

Third Level Degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering or related field
5+ years relevant industry experience
Experience in manual and automated testing on web applications and REST APIs.
Strong scripting/ programming skills using Python or similar and selenium webdriver
Detailed knowledge of manual and automated testing best practice
Good working knowledge of IP networking protocols and systems
Ease with Linux/Unix OSes
Excellent problem-solving, debugging and troubleshooting skills
Excellent verbal and written English-language communication skills
Self-motivated, highly enthusiastic team player with strong analytical skills
Results oriented, works to achieve high levels of personal and organizational performance to meet or exceed objectives.

Industry certifications such as ISTQB, CCNA, CCNP highly desirable

In today’s software-centric economy, speed is everything. The pressure to deliver more, faster, falls squarely on development teams. Sauce Labs accelerates software development by removing testing as a bottleneck. We run the world's largest cloud-based platform for automated and live testing cloud to ensure that the web and mobile applications people use everyday work flawlessly on any browser or device.

Backtrace is now a Sauce Labs Company! With the combination of Sauce Labs and Backtrace, developers in the gaming, mobile, and web application space can quickly observe and remediate errors in production while also leveraging those insights to expand and improve future test coverage during the development and integration phases of CI/CD.

Backtrace.io is a cross-platform automated error monitoring solution focused on gaming for desktop, mobile, devices, game consoles, and server platforms that helps development organizations reduce debugging time and improve software quality. Though purpose-built for developers, Backtrace is used by stakeholders throughout the SDLC, including QA and operations professionals. Backtrace’s high-fidelity error data, powerful analytics, and industry-leading scalability make it ideal for games, mobile, and web applications where the sheer numbers of users and complexity of environments demand a high-performance error monitoring platform. We’re a diverse, technical group joined by the mission to make software better.

As a Sales Engineer, you will be responsible for assessing customer requirements, qualifying customers, articulating the Backtrace solution through product demos and presentations, and communicating customer requirements to internal teams. After deals close, the Sales Engineer leads the graceful transition of high-level implementation requirements to the implementation team. Additionally, as part of the primary customer-facing team, the Sales Engineer will inform Product of the latest needs and trends in the gaming industry.


Qualify new customers based on their technical requirements, use cases, and other needs. 
Lead product and technical discussions with customers, including product demo walkthroughs; responding to RFI/RFQ/RFP; and creating proposals, presentations, and other sales collateral. 
Architect the Backtrace solution tailored for each customer and convincingly communicate the story to them 
Design implementation plans to seamlessly transition the customer to the implementation team. 
Collaborate with the Product organization on addressing customer requirements needed to close deals and successfully implement. 

 
3+ years experience in customer-facing technical roles, sales or sales engineering experience is a plus. 
Hands on experience with either IOS or Android:
Swift and/or Objective C for IOS 
Java, Kotlin, and C++ for Android. 
Hands-on experience developing for Mobile frameworks 
Demonstrated ability to deeply learn and educate others on a technical product. 
Excellent consulting and problem solving skills to understand customer use cases and design solutions for those needs. 
Capable of commanding a room of a diverse audience, including: executives, business, and technical resources, while exuding excitement and confidence. 
Not required, but nice to have: hands-on experience with Unity and/or Unreal gaming engines.
